title: Man accidentally shoots son-in-law dead after he jumped out of bush to surprise him
text:
Richard Dennis (left) shot his son-in-law, Christopher Bergan, to death after he jumped out of his bushes and startled him. (Picture: Facebook)

A dad accidentally shot his son-in-law dead after he jumped out of a bush to surprise him for his birthday.

Richard Dennis, 61, gunned down his daughter’s husband, 37-year-old Christopher Bergan, on Tuesday in the backyard of his home in Gulf Breeze, Florida in what police are calling a ‘horrible accident.’

Bergan had just flown in from Norway to surprise Dennis for his birthday, police said.

He arrived at Dennis’s home late at night before knocking on the back door without announcing himself – but Bergan had no idea that Dennis was already on edge because of a previous altercation that day.

Authorities said Dennis and another relative got into an argument hours before the accidental shooting. During the confrontation, the relative banged on Dennis’s front door, police said, although they released few details about the incident.

Tense from the previous argument, Dennis armed himself with a .380 semi-automatic firearm when Bergan knocked on his back door later that night.

After knocking, Bergan hid in a bush. He jumped out when Dennis opened the door and startled his father-in-law, who fired one shot that fatally struck Bergan in the heart, killing him instantly, Santa Rosa County Sheriff Bob Johnson said at a Thursday morning press conference.

Assistant State Attorney Amber Rowland said Dennis will not be charged in the incident.

Sheriff Johnson said: ‘I’m not going to second guess Mr Dennis for what he did.

‘Here he is, he had just had a confrontation at the front of his house.’

‘Couple hours later, someone is banging on his back door, and it’s a fenced yard.

‘And then someone jumps out of the bushes.

‘You can’t really say anything against Mr Dennis for doing what he did.’
description: Richard Dennis, 61, gunned down his daughter's husband, 37-year-old Christopher Bergan, on Tuesday at his home in Gulf Breeze, Florida.
